alert.note: Alert for Watauga; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 4:28PM EDT until September 12 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Ashe, Watauga and Wilkes. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Flat Branch, Little Fork, Middle Fork Reddies River, Fall Creek, Little Dugger Creek, North Prong Lewis Fork, Elk Creek, Dugger Creek, Little Fork Creek, North Fork Reddies River, Mill Creek and Left Prong Stony Fork. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boone... Blowing Rock... Deep Gap... Wilbar... Cascade Falls... Darby... Summit... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
